answers.answer: Have you had a thyroidectomy? I take synthroid for cancer suppression, so sometimes get heart palps. Recently, my heart rate was 113 so I called my neighbor doctor.  She said it wasn't overly high for my synthroid dose, but said to eliminate caffine for a couple of days.  It was explained to me by another forum member that the tiredness comes from the heart palps, as it is like rigerous exercise.Trish

Thank you Trish for the comment.  No I still have my thyroid but both of my parents alsohave Hashimoto's thyroiditis.  We have lots of autoimmune diseases, but never cancer--even when we look at humdreds of relatives!  Guess these are all autoimmune things--Addison's (father), type 1 Diabetes (son), rhumatoid arthritis (grandmother, mother and husband), alopecia (mther), Meniere's (husband), vitiligo, hives,ibs (me and daughter) and MS (cousin).We ususally die of old age heart failur (over 90) or anurism (much younger-aunt an five cousins).I drink a lot of water and eat tons of salt. With the thyroid meds my bp has been staying in the 100-115/70 range.  I just wondered about the low bp and high resting heart rate.My insurance is caastrophic (still over 300/month) so medical tests are a real stretch, 140. every time i see my gp.  One more year!

Your BP seems really good to me. Mine is around 135-140 over 85-90.  We are very fortunate in Canada to have free medical care, although everyone pays with taxes. My whole cancer journey did not cost me anything except meals etc. when going to the hospital 2 hours away. No charge for visits to GP or specialists.  Does your insurance cover visits to your GP?Trish

My mother was Canadian but they wouldn't let me immigrate as it was not my father! (I was born in 1944 and Canada changed the requirement in 1947).My insurance cover's no physicals, glasses, hearing or drugs--ever.  After the 1750.00 deductable each year, they pay 80%.  I got a pap smear and it cost 350.00!  My husband is now on Medicare (over 65) but when he retired, to replace our decent health insurance (20.00 co-pay for office calls in network) was gong to cost us 1600.00/monthMy daughter passed a kidney stone and had no insurance (a temporary gap as most employers make you wait 3-12 months).  Her MRI at the hospital cost 6000.00, + 800.00 ER fee, + 800.00 ER doctor's fee.  When she couldn't pay it all at once they ruined her credit.  Half of all bankruptcies in the US are medical related.One in six in the US have no insurance but they don't say how many, like me, are under insured.  If people have good insurance, and that is over half of the population (either through their work or because they are on the dole) they don't want the taxes to pay for everyone.Enjoy your good fortune!

Wow! I don't know what to say.  That does not seem right.  With an election coming, do any parties promise increased spending on health care.  I can't get over your daughter's medical bill.  The average person could not do it.  Take care.Trish

question: I am a 64 yo female, watching TV tnight and my blood pressure is 85/60 with a heart rate of 107.  I recently had my TSH tested and am on meds for that.  Should I be concerned? (Don't take any other drugs or vitamins).  Seem very tired.
title: Low blood pressure/fast heart rate
